map.name: GetBattleOutcome

args.name: *out (0 = player won, 1 = player lost, 2 = player ran, 3 = enemy ran)

map.notes: whether the player gets a game over from losing is determined by the battle script. should also be a value for 4.

map.name: DoNpcDefeat
map.notes: kills parent's defeat script and replaces it with an instance of 80077E38

map.name: StartBattle
map.notes: begins a battle with the NPC's assigned encounter

map.name: StartBattleWith
map.notes: same as the previous, but you can set the song

map.name: BindNpcAI
map.notes: ("NpcAI")

map.name: BindNpcIdle
map.notes: ("Idle")  -- paused while the interaction prompt is active, executes after init is done

map.name: RestartNpcAI
map.notes: kills the current AI script and launches a new copy

map.name: EnableNpcAI
map.notes: pauses/unpauses AI script for a given npc

map.name: SetNpcAux
map.notes: kills the current aux script and launches a new one from $Script

map.name: BindNpcAux
map.notes: ("Aux") -- helper script that executes after init script is done, loop for a continous background script

map.name: RestartNpcAux
map.notes: kills the current aux script and launches a new copy

map.name: EnableNpcAux
map.notes: pauses/unpauses aux script for a given npc

map.name: BindNpcInteract
map.notes: ("Interact")

map.name: BindNpcHit
map.notes: ("Hit")

map.name: BindNpcDefeat
map.notes: ("Defeat") -- executes after battle

map.name: SetNpcVar
map.notes: sets (&NPC + 6C + 4*index) to value, looks like there are 16 of them

map.name: SetOwnerFlags
map.notes: directly sets flags of parent NPC

map.name: ShowCoinCounter
map.notes: shows coin counter in lower left hand corner

map.name: MakeEntity
map.notes: custom arg spec

args.name: transition type (fade to white/black, star wipe, mario head cutout, curtain close, etc)

map.name: GetEntryID
map.notes: returns the entrance ID that the player used to enter the current map

map.name: GetMapID
map.notes: used by the forever forest maps (mim_*) to load current ID to a game byte

map.name: GetLoadType

args.name: *type (0 = loaded from another map | 1 = loaded from main menu)

map.notes: used for spawning the player at save points

map.name: NpcJump0
map.notes: calls 802CE434 with A2 :         IS THIS FOR FLYING?

map.name: NpcJump1
map.notes: calls 802CE434 with A2 : 1

map.name: NpcJumpX
map.notes: moves an npc in a parabolic arc

map.name: InterpNpcYaw
map.notes: turns gradually over some number of frames (however, turn animation will often be abrupt)

map.name: NpcFacePlayer

args.name: ??? (1 allows looking back and forth between targets, 0 = fixed?)

map.notes: set yaw to face player

map.name: NpcFaceNpc

args.name: npcID to face toward (cannot be player)
??? (1 allows looking back and forth between targets, 0 = fixed?)

map.notes: set yaw to face other NPC

map.name: DisablePartnerAI
map.notes: ??? -- partner will no longer try to follow mario, still has physics though

map.name: EnablePartnerAI
map.notes: enables follow player AI

map.name: BringPartnerOut
map.notes: brings out temporary extra partner, Npc:Partner will refer to this temporary partner until they are put away

map.name: PutPartnerAway
map.notes: puts away a temporary partner

map.name: ShowMessage
map.notes: used by signs and NPCs that cannot be seen, speech bubble doesn't connect to anything

map.name: ShowChoice
map.notes: chosen index will be returned in *Var[0]

map.name: DisablePlayerPhysics
map.notes: disables gravity, automatic animations (falling, etc), camera controller updates, but NOT partner AI

map.name: PlayerFaceNpc

args.name: ??? (1 allows looking back and forth between targets, 0 = fixed?)

map.notes: set player yaw to face npc

map.name: GetPlayerAnimation
map.notes: return player[C8]

map.name: FullyRestoreHPandFP
map.notes: no args

map.name: FullyRestoreSP
map.notes: no args

map.name: DisablePulseStone
map.notes: sets a flag that make pulse stone appear on sbk maps

battle.name: GetSprite
battle.notes: *** args = actorID, sprite index -- returns pointer to sprite

battle.name: GetActor
battle.notes: *** accepts an actorID and returns a pointer

battle.name: UseCamPreset
battle.notes: if (byte) 80280CE0 != 0, index into jump table at 8029CC48... [8024CFA8]

battle.name: SetCamTarget
battle.notes: sets the camera target position

battle.name: SetCamOffsetZ
battle.notes: bugged? treats z offset as a short rather than a byte.

battle.name: AddCamOffsetZ
battle.notes: unused and bugged. treats z offset as a short rather than a byte.

args.name: change in radial distance from target

battle.name: FreezeCam
battle.notes: sets (byte) 80280CE0

battle.name: CamTargetActor
battle.notes: if (byte) 80280CE0 != 0, delegates to func_8024E43C, which sets (short) 8029F27C = actorID

args.name: move time  !!! terrible name! moves the camera to a preset over a certain number of frames
variable quantity (used for "attack power increased by X", etc)

battle.name: SetDmaTableLoadDest
battle.notes: sets the destination for the next function, overriding the default value specified in the table

battle.name: LoadFromDmaTable
battle.notes: loads one of the entries in the current battle sections DmaTable

battle.name: PlaySoundAtActor
battle.notes: ### args : actorID, soundID

battle.name: PlaySoundAtSprite
battle.notes: ### args : actorID, spriteIndex, soundID

battle.name: MultiplyByActorScale
battle.notes: multiplies a scalar by an actor's scale factor (actor[188])

battle.name: MultiplyVec2ByActorScale
battle.notes: multiplies 2D vector by an actor's scale factor (actor[188])

battle.name: MultiplyVec3ByActorScale
battle.notes: multiplies 3D vector by an actor's scale factor (actor[188])

battle.name: IncrementPlayerHP
battle.notes: no args, will not exceed maximum

battle.name: IncrementPlayerFP
battle.notes: no args, will not exceed maximum

battle.name: GetBlockResult
battle.notes: returns result of most recent block attempt, 0 for fail, 1 for success, -1 for fail on mashing

battle.name: get_nearest_home_index
battle.notes: gets the nearest home index to a given point

args.name: *out element of last attack from battle[188]

battle.name: SetGoalToHome
battle.notes: sets goal position to NPC's home position

battle.name: SetGoalToIndex
battle.notes: sets goal position to a standard indexed location (table at 80283524)

battle.name: GetIndexFromPos
battle.notes: gets the nearest home index given an actor's current position

battle.name: GetIndexFromHome
battle.notes: gets the nearest home index given an actor's home position

battle.name: ForceHomePos
battle.notes: sets home position and teleports there

battle.name: SetGoalToTarget
battle.notes: sets goal to the position of the actor's target

battle.name: SetGoalToPos
battle.notes: note: skips any arg = FF439EB2 (-12345678`)

battle.name: AddToGoalPos
battle.notes: adjust goal position

battle.name: GetSpriteOffset
battle.notes: if sprite[0] & 00100000 return sprite[2C/30/34] else return sprite[14/16/18] ...not consistent with other SpriteOffset functions!

battle.name: SetSpritePos
battle.notes: if sprite[0] & 00100000 set sprite[2C/30/34] to x/y/z, else set sprite[14/16/18] to x/y/z

battle.name: SetEnemyTargetOffset
battle.notes: only works for enemy actors: actorID = 020X

battle.name: AddActorPos
battle.notes: adds to current position

battle.name: GetSpriteOffset2
battle.notes: if sprite[0] & 00100000, return sprite[1A/1C/1E], else return sprite[14/16/18]

battle.name: SetSpriteOffset
battle.notes: if sprite[0] & 00100000, set sprite[1A/1C/1E] to x/y/z, else set sprite[14/16/18] to x/y/z

battle.name: AddSpriteOffset
battle.notes: if sprite[0] & 00100000, add dx/dy/dz to sprite[1A/1C/1E], else add dx/dy/dz to sprite[14/16/18]

battle.name: ActorVarAdd
battle.notes: adds amount to variable

battle.name: SpriteVarAdd
battle.notes: adds amount to variable

battle.name: SetActorRotation
battle.notes: center of rotation is at base of sprite, use F1194D80 on any field to skip it

battle.name: SetActorRotationOffset
battle.notes: offsets the center of rotation from default position (bottom center)

battle.name: SetSpriteRotationOffset
battle.notes: offsets the center of rotation from default position (bottom center)

battle.name: HPBarToHome
battle.notes: ### args : actorID, sets the location of the HP bar to home + hp offset

args.name: flag? (0 : default | 1 : general guy) : RETURNS enemy ID on *Var[0]

battle.name: GetOwnerID
battle.notes: returns the actorID of a script owner

battle.name: SetOwnerID
battle.notes: set script owner to some actorID

battle.name: InitTargetIterator
battle.notes: no args

battle.name: BoostAttack
battle.notes: icons for amount > 3 does not display correctly

battle.name: DispatchEventActor
battle.notes: *** (*actor, eventID) -- kills running HandleEvent / TakeTurn scripts

battle.name: DispatchEventPlayer
battle.notes: *** (eventID) -- kills running HandleEvent / TakeTurn scripts

battle.name: DispatchEventPlayer2
battle.notes: *** (eventID) -- kills running HandleEvent script

battle.name: DamageEnemy
battle.notes: read doc: "Damage and Event System"

battle.name: PowerBounceEnemy
battle.notes: identical to DamageEnemy, used only for Power Bounce

battle.name: CheckEnemyHit
battle.notes: read doc: "Damage and Event System"

battle.name: BindTakeTurn
battle.notes: binds a script to execute when their turn begins

battle.name: BindIdle
battle.notes: binds a script to execute while idle (goombas shuffle back and forth, etc)

battle.name: BindHandleEvent
battle.notes: binds a script to respond to battle events

battle.name: BindNextTurn
battle.notes: binds a script to the start/end of player/enemy turns (4 events), discriminate with GetBattlePhase

args.name: boolean use dust effect (flag 1 for script[7C])
move time (only moves in a horizontal plane)

battle.name: JumpSpriteA
battle.notes: strange (bugged?) function signature that ignores the last argument. this is the only version that is called though!

battle.name: JumpSpriteB
battle.notes: always creates dust effect

battle.name: RunSpriteTo
battle.notes: moves with a trail of dust behind

battle.name: GetEventType
battle.notes: --- maybe GetLastEvent?

battle.name: SetTargetActor
battle.notes: sets the attack target of one actor, also sets (byte) actor[426] = 1

battle.name: RemoveActor
battle.notes: removes an actor

battle.name: DropStarPoints
battle.notes: causes star points to spew out

battle.name: DamageTarget
battle.notes: used to damage Mario/partner/sometimes other enemies

battle.name: SetTargetOffset
battle.notes: more commonly used variant of func_8026B0A0, works on any actor

battle.name: YieldTurn
battle.notes: Sets battle[0] bit 00200000

battle.name: DispatchEventPartner
battle.notes: *** (eventID) -- kills running HandleEvent / TakeTurn scripts

battle.name: DispatchEventPartner2
battle.notes: *** (eventID) -- kills running HandleEvent script

battle.name: GetLevel
battle.notes: gets the level of an enemy or the rank of a partner

battle.name: InflictStatusP
battle.notes: used by partners to afflict enemies with status effects, has an extra argument to allow variable chance to inflict

battle.name: CheckTargetHitP
battle.notes: used by partner moves to check whether attacks will hit enemies

shared.name: SetTexPanner
shared.notes: sets a model's panID and sets the texture pan flag

shared.name: ParentColliderToModel
shared.notes: associates a model with a collider and applies the model's transformation

shared.name: SetCamPerspective
shared.notes: this type is NOT the same camera type from zones, fortunately it is ALWAYS 3 here

shared.name: SetCamBGColor
shared.notes: components are in range 0-255, this is almost always black (0,0,0). only ice palace is different.

shared.name: PanToTarget
shared.notes: pans the camera with a cosine easing function at the ends

shared.name: UseSettingsFrom
shared.notes: camera will use control settings from the zone corresponding to a given sampling point

shared.name: WaitForCam
shared.notes: checks if the camera has completed its assigned motion yet

shared.name: ResetCam
shared.notes: copies settings from the player's zone and pans to the player at a given speed

args.name: roll (around x/y/z, center of rotation is at base of sprite)

shared.name: AwaitPlayerApproach
shared.notes: pauses the script until the player comes within a certain radius of point (X,Z)

shared.name: IsPlayerWithin
shared.notes: returns whether the player is within a certain radius of point (X,Z)

shared.name: AwaitPlayerLeave
shared.notes: pauses the script until the player moves beyond a certain radius from point (X,Z)

shared.name: AddVectorPolar
shared.notes: offsets a point (X,Z) by a vector given by length and angle

shared.name: SetValueByRef
shared.notes: sets the variable referenced by arg0 to the value of arg1                     X = GetVar(arg0), Y = GetVar(arg1), SetVar(X, Y)

shared.name: GetValueByRef
shared.notes: gets the value held by the variable referenced in arg0 and copies it to arg1  X = GetVar(arg0), Y = GetVar(X), SetVar(arg1, Y)

shared.name: PlaySoundAtF
shared.notes: we get looping sounds if the upper byte is 80

args.name: *out key item slot (FFFF if not found)
*out item slot (FFFF if none were available)
*out item slot (FFFF if none were removed)

shared.name: RemoveBadge
shared.notes: unequips and removes badge from inventory

args.name: message box flags (0 = item, 10 = "1 coin", 20 = "3 star pieces", ...)

shared.name: SetSpriteShading
shared.notes: sets the shading effect on character sprites (but not items) in dark areas

args.name: *dest (0 ordinary gameplay | 1 manually issuing commands in demo | 2 demo map transition?)
button code to OR with existing buttons
button code to negate and AND with existing buttons

shared.name: load_hit_data
shared.notes: loads internal collision or zone data from a hit file

shared.name: sprintf
shared.notes: used to combine %s_shape%s_hit with map names

shared.name: use_consumable
shared.notes: uses the item at index in inventory
